DataElement.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Flow Rate ISO21090.RTO.PQ,PQ.TIMEv1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A ratio specifying the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. EXAMPLE(S): 100 mL/h, 1 g/d, 40 mmol/h.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity Flow Rate
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._The motion characteristic of fluids and gases; the amount of fluid that flows in a given time, e.g. through an body organ or part, expressed as volume per unit of time (called also flow rate).:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Administration Intervention or Procedure Reuse Template Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A material with particular features.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:To use again.:Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Something that establishes or serves as a pattern for reference; a form, mold, or pattern used as a guide to making something.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The motion characteristic of fluids and gases; the amount of fluid that flows in a given time, e.g. through an body organ or part, expressed as volume per unit of time (called also flow rate).:A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: The continuous movement characteristic of a liquid or gas.
A measurement of degree, speed, or frequency relative to time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Quantity quotient of a numerator of type PQ divided by a denominator of type PQ.TIME.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
